However, where 2012Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s Blues Funeral allowed a hint of yer actual goth to creep into Mark LaneganÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s American gothic, here he indulges the post-punk and electronics he grew up with. His gravelly voice is accompanied by purring, New Orderish synthesisers; the superb Floor of the Ocean could be the Sisters of Mercy covering Joy DivisionÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s New Dawn Fades. The subject matter (death, sin, the occasional hanging) is hardly any cheerier, but Torn Red Heart might be the most beautiful love song Lanegan has ever recorded.
